column1: An IVP is done in a hospital radiology department or a health care provider's office.
Your provider will inject an iodine-based contrast (dye) into a vein in your arm.
Some people develop a headache, nausea, or vomiting after the dye is injected.
An IVP can be used to evaluate: - An abdominal injury - Bladder and kidney infections - Blood in the urine - Flank pain (possibly due to kidney stones) - Tumors
